definition: to join a society, association etc
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Fill in this form to apply for membership.
He was blackballed by the committee because of his recent scandal.
sentences.chinese: 他因最近的醜聞而被委員會投票駁回入會申請。

sentences.english: Consider all fees associated with each group.
sentences.chinese: 將每個社團的入會費綜合起來考慮。

sentences.english: All members must pay the Foundation Fee when they register as members.
sentences.chinese: 個人會員及團體會員須於入會時繳交基金費。

sentences.english: To fill in the Membership Application Form, hand in 2photoes.
sentences.chinese: 入會時須填寫入會登記表，交2張照片。

sentences.english: To fill in the Membership Application Form, hand in 2photoes.
sentences.chinese: 入會時須填寫入會登記表，交2張照片。

sentences.english: One-time Ordinary Membership Fee is HKD10 only.
sentences.chinese: 普通會員一次性入會費用爲港幣拾圓正。

sentences.english: Corporate Nominee Membership can be transferred to any other individual .
sentences.chinese: 公司會員記名入會者可單獨轉讓。

sentences.english: They have initiation fees and monthly minimums, all within the means of this target segment.
sentences.chinese: 通常的收費方式是入會費和每月的最低消費相結合。

sentences.english: What he said at the meeting astonished everybody present.
sentences.chinese: 他在會議上的發言時所有入會者喫驚。

sentences.english: They’d receive an Apple computer as part of their membership perks.
sentences.chinese: 他們可以獲得一臺蘋果電腦作爲入會饋贈。

sentences.english: Initiates approved should pay the membership fees on time.
sentences.chinese: 凡獲批准入會者，必須按時繳交會費。

sentences.english: Document evidencing membership in the SITCA;
sentences.chinese: 同業公會同意入會之證明文件。

sentences.english: He's joining the club in order to take advantage of the others.
Have potential for future enhancements such as online payment of fees for membership, workshops, etc.
sentences.chinese: 增強對未來的潛力，如網上支付入會費，講習班等。

sentences.english: Users of the site pay a one-time joining fee of $520.
sentences.chinese: 該網站的成員需一次性支付入會費520美元。

definition: to ratchet up/to raise (expectations etc)/to increase (a quota, a position in the market etc)/to up the ante/(computing) to encode
to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
